artist: Artist: Alexander Calder; Editor: Compiled by Richard Wilbur; Publisher: Pantheon Books, New York; Printer: The Spiral Press, New York , (Joseph Blumenthal)
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: binding: leather/buckram; endpapers: white wove paper; slip case: paper over borders with paper label
image_copyright: © 2015 Calder Foundation%2C New York %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
markings: Numbered in dark brown ink on colophon page: 5
provenance: Ruth and Bruce Dayton, Wayzata, MInn.; given to MIA, 1991.
signed: Signed by artist and compiler in dark brown ink on colophon page: Alexander Calder / Richard Wilbur
text: A traditional bestiary contains descriptions of animals, real and imaginary, along with moralizing allegorical interpretations of their traits and habits. For this modern-day bestiary, Alexander Calder contributed dozens of whimsical line drawings of animals and famous authors as a visual counterpoint to Richard Wilbur’s eclectic selection of excerpts from classic works of literature. Moral lessons are mostly absent.
title: A Bestiary
